metadata.title: CVE-2018-4192 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11.4 isaffected. Safari before 11.1.1 is affected. iCloud before 7.5 on Windows isaffected. iTunes before 12.7.5 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11.4 isaffected. watchOS before 4.3.1 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit"component. It allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via acrafted web site that leverages a race condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.1-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
